meanings.definition: To be parallel to or in alignment with something else.
meanings.sent1: The road was paralleling the river, running alongside it smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The train tracks were paralleling each other, never crossing paths.
meanings.sent3: The two friends were paralleling their dance moves, unintentionally mirroring each other.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were paralleling the twists and turns of the rollercoaster ride.
meanings.sent5: The shadow was paralleling his every move, like a faithful companion.

meanings.definition: To occur at the same time or in a similar manner.
meanings.sent1: The thunder paralleling the lightning, creating a dramatic display in the sky.
meanings.sent2: Her actions were paralleling her words, showing true sincerity.
meanings.sent3: The twins were paralleling each other's movements, causing confusion for onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The rise in temperature was paralleling the increase in ice cream sales.
meanings.sent5: The music was paralleling the emotions of the characters, enhancing the movie experience.

meanings.definition: To compare or liken two things.
meanings.sent1: She was paralleling his behavior to that of a mischievous monkey.
meanings.sent2: The author was paralleling the protagonist to a modern-day hero.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was paralleling the student's progress to a growing plant.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was paralleling the depth of the ocean, vast and unending.
meanings.sent5: The artist was paralleling the colors in the painting to the changing seasons, creating a beautiful masterpiece.
